intro: Pilosella schultesii subsp. atra, commonly known as the dark pilosella, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features dense, woolly foliage that is typically dark green to almost black in color, giving it its common name. It produces small yellow flowers arranged in flat-topped clusters, which bloom in late summer. This subspecies is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
